page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is a coastal area on the North Cornish coast.The magnificent slate cliffs are broken by golden beaches at the mouths of the small streams which run through steep sided valleys, between flat-topped hills. The largest settlement is the village of St.Merryn to the E. Settlements, at the bays ,are the result of tourism which with farming is the major industry.Most people live in bungalows.The area suffers a population inbalance with the emigration of the young adults and the immigration of the elderly. Many of the farmers supplement their income by running campsites on their land during the summer months. Transport is limited as most of the roads are very narrow and the public bus service runs only in the summer.
